item.title: Create fast value by slicing and dicing reporting user stories
item.description:
Create fast value by slicing and dicing reporting user stories

Splitting user stories is a way to shorten the feedback cycle while you work on a product. When you work on building reports, you're improving the information that the product team has available to it — in other words, you're improving the quality of feedback. So, shortening the feedback cycle of reporting user stories by splitting them up is an effective way to quickly boost the value that your team can create.

item.title: Using scenarios to improve user story quality
item.description:
Using scenarios to improve user story quality

Guidelines to creating high-quality user stories 

Here are a few comments that emerged from notes I took at Amir Barylko’s recent presentation, User Stories Deep Dive.

item.title: Design doesn't deserve a seat at the table
item.description:
Design doesn't deserve a seat at the table

Jon Schlossberg on the rising profile of design, and what it really means to have a "seat at the table" in the startup world.

item.title: Introduction
item.description:
Introduction

These days I spend the vast majority of my time writing the code that makes websites work. Product people work with designers, then hand off user stories to my team. We then pull details out of the user stories and teach computers how to make websites out of them.
